AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raymond McMillon: defendant and appellant in an alien transportation case, convicted of several offenses and sentenced to 41 months' imprisonment, traveled with co-defendant Zeba Williams from Houston to San Antonio and then to Laredo, was a passenger in the tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Zeba Williams: individual allegedly transporting aliens with McMillon, drove the tractor-trailer, co-conspirator, testified at sentencing that McMillon did not recruit her to commit the offenses and that they entered a joint partnership to smuggle aliens, gave consent to open the door during the checkpoint stop, asked McMillon to accompany him in a tractor-trailer to Laredo, was driving the tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Luis Pena: Government agent narrating the checkpoint stop, testified at trial, asked Williams to open the door without ordering him to do so, approached the driver-side door of the tractor-trailer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Manuel Hernandez: Government agent narrating the checkpoint stop, testified at trial, prepared to have his canine perform a sniff of the tractor-trailer's exterior
